verses.roman:
ei jīva--sanakādi saba muni-jana
'nirgrantha'--mūrkha, nīca, sthāvara-paśu-gaṇa

synonyms: ei jīva—these living entities; sanaka-ādi saba muni-jana—all the great personalities, such as Sanaka and Sanātana; nirgrantha—down to the illiterate; mūrkha—foolish person; nīca—lowborn; sthāvara—the trees and plants; paśu-gaṇa—the beasts and birds.
translation: "Living entities include great personalities like the four Kumāras, low-class foolish people, trees, plants, birds and beasts.
